snippet: The Supreme Court’s McCutcheon decision strengthens democracy by enabling the parties to take back power from major donors.
abstract: David Brooks Op-Ed column contends decision in Supreme Court case McCutcheon v Federal Election Commission is a victory for the political parties, as it enables party establishments to claw back some power that has flowed to donors and super PACS; maintains that stronger parties, which foster coalition thinking and raise accountability, will make races more competitive and democracy more legitimate.
lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court’s McCutcheon decision strengthens democracy by enabling the parties to take back power from major donors.
